thread.title: Local golfers raise money for Meals on Wheels
thread.title_full: Local golfers raise money for Meals on Wheels

title: Local golfers raise money for Meals on Wheels
persons: Dale Johnson Brian M. Bergner Jr
text: Local golfers raise money for Meals on Wheels Brian M. Bergner Jr./The Daily CourierErik Hurt putts on hole No. 9 as his teammates look on at the Prescott Golf & Country Club during the fourth annual Meals on Wheels Golf Tournament on Saturday. 4th Annual Meals On Wheels Golf Tournament Prescott Golf & Country ClubTop 10 Team Scramble ResultsPlace Foursome Score Par1st Andrew Zeiger 55 -17 David Frausto2nd James Rivera 57 -15 Matt McCall3rd Larry Stephan* 59 -13 Marshall Hiller*T-4th Spencer Sizelove 59 -13 Erick WorthT-4th Joe Thornhill 59 -13 Brandon BoldueT-4th Erik Mevissen 59 -13 Ryan Brinkley7th Dave Moya 60 -12 Jeff HallT-8th Kimberly Bierschwale 61 -11 Chris Swanner T-8th Michael Pappin 61 -11 Jim DavisT-8th Colin Flaherty 61 -11 Dale Johnson Brian M. Bergner Jr. The Daily Courier DEWEY, Ariz. - A cool breeze on a sun-splashed afternoon set the stage for perfect golf conditions at the Prescott Golf & Country Club as more than 120 players swung their way through an 18-hole scramble event for charity Saturday.The fourth annual Meals on Wheels Golf Tournament, put on by Prescott Area Young Professionals, brought players from all over the Tri-City area, and beyond.Kimberly Bierschwale of Speech Rehabilitation Services said she was glad to be involved with such a good cause."It's nice to have some fun with friends and know that the money is going to a worthy charity," Bierschwale said as her team finished up the 484-yard hole nine. "We're holding our own out here, we probably won't win, but we are having a good time."Bierschwale's team, including Chris Swanner, Miguel Martinez and Erik Hurt, finished tied for eighth with an 11-under par 61.The top prize of the tournament would go to Andrew Zeiger, David Frausto, Tom Liberg and Ken Creighton, who combined to finish first overall with a 17-under par 55.Taking second was James Rivera, Matt McCall and Jerod McDaniels with a 57 [-15] while Larry Stephan, Marshall Hiller, Toby Tyler and Joel Hiller won a scorecard playoff to take third overall with a 13-under par 59.No matter the result, however, Kris Crane of Chino Valley, who is part of the Ruger company, said that the money going for a good cause is what matters most."Ruger always supports the local community, as well as the national foundations," Crane said. "It's good to be a part of it. It's another sunny day here in Arizona. I don't know about a win, but we're going to have some fun and enjoy each other's company."Other top performances from the tournament include Spencer Sizelove, Erick Worth, Derek Sims and Jimmy Shafer, who combined to shoot a 59 [-13]. They tied with foursome Joe Thornhill, Brandon Boldue, Grant Fernow and Jim Troy, and foursome Erik Mevissen, Ryan Brinkley and Greg Goligosky.Taking seventh overall was Dave Moya, Jeff Hall, Brad Dureya and Shannon Dureya with a 12-under par 60.To wrap up the top 10, two other teams tied Bierschwale's team for eighth overall in foursome Michael Pappin, Jim Davis, Michael Zimmer and Lisa Nichols. Foursome Colin Flaherty, Dale Johnson, Richard Wright and Thomas Wright were also in the mix.Follow Brian M. Bergner Jr. on Twitter at @SportsWriter52 or reach him by phone at (928) 445-3333, ext. 1106, or (928) 899-6946.
